data.text: @lucyhascancer My onc said I can get it when it’s available to me, BUT because of my history I HAVE to be in a clinical or hospital setting. Somewhere there are epi pens & trained emergency responders! 🤞we all get there soon!

@theemzremy There’s not a lot of research for the vaccine & anything yet! Chemo does strip away a lot & make you vulnerable to infection. Which is why getting the vaccine is important. It’s going to teach your body how to fight off this particular virus. *I’m not a doctor*
@CancerMermaid Theres not enough research on the vaccine and Chemo patients. My Onc said to get it, but my thinking is why if Chemo strips everything out?
@CancerMermaid Can relate. My husband (military) should get his soon. My oncologist has said no vaccine for me right now because of immunotherapy.
@badbaldbecky Since I’m no longer high risk (yay) I have to wait (boo).
@CancerMermaid Did your onc say when/if you can get one?
